item.title: Projects
item.description: Bellow you will find some of the projects I created. BETA: stands for B basEd Testing Approach. It is a tool-supported approach, based on the B-Method formal notation, to generate test cases. It uses restrictions described on a B model, such as invariants, preconditions and conditional statements, to create unit tests for an operation. You can read more about BETA on my Ph.D thesis, in some of the papers here and in the tool’s website.

item.title: Reading
item.description: Here is a list of books that I’ve read and that I usually recommend to people: Managing Humans: Biting and Humorous Tales of a Software Engineering Manager by Michael Lopp. The Pragmatic Programmer: From Journeyman to Master by Andrew Hunt and David Thomas. Growing Object-Oriented Software, Guided by Tests by Steve Freeman and Nat Pryce. Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World by Cal Newport. 99 Bottles of OOP: A Practical Guide to Object-Oriented Design by Sandi Metz and Katrina Owen.
